docs.text: Markdown test ¶ Math ¶ Euler's formula e^{i\theta} = \cos \theta + i\sin \theta e^{i\theta} = \cos \theta + i\sin \theta \theta = \pi : e^{i\pi}+1=0 \theta = \pi : e^{i\pi}+1=0 Note This is note. Info This is info.
docs.title: Markdown test

docs.text: Euler's formula e^{i\theta} = \cos \theta + i\sin \theta e^{i\theta} = \cos \theta + i\sin \theta \theta = \pi : e^{i\pi}+1=0 \theta = \pi : e^{i\pi}+1=0 Note This is note. Info This is info.
docs.title: Math

docs.text: rclone ¶ Commands ¶ rclone copy "source:sourcepath" "dest:destpath" rclone sync "source:path" "dest:path" [flags] flags: --create-empty-src-dirs Create empty source dirs on destination after sync rclone ls "remote:path" [flags] ls to list size and path of objects only lsl to list modification time, size and path of objects only lsd to list directories only lsf to list objects and directories in easy to parse format lsjson to list objects and directories in JSON format rclone tree "remote:path" Flags ¶ -n, --dry-run -P, --progress Reference ¶ https://rclone.org/
docs.title: rclone

docs.text: rclone copy "source:sourcepath" "dest:destpath" rclone sync "source:path" "dest:path" [flags] flags: --create-empty-src-dirs Create empty source dirs on destination after sync rclone ls "remote:path" [flags] ls to list size and path of objects only lsl to list modification time, size and path of objects only lsd to list directories only lsf to list objects and directories in easy to parse format lsjson to list objects and directories in JSON format rclone tree "remote:path"
docs.title: Commands

docs.text: rsync ¶ Backup ¶ /etc/cron.daily/backup #!/bin/bash rsync -a --delete --quiet /folder/to/backup /location/of/backup if [ $? ! = "0" ] ; then echo "rsync backup failed." else tar -acf /var/backup/home- ` date +%Y%m%d ` .tar.zst /location/of/backup fi Reference ¶ rsync - ArchWiki Trying to create a cron to Rsync then tar the folder
docs.title: rsync

docs.text: /etc/cron.daily/backup #!/bin/bash rsync -a --delete --quiet /folder/to/backup /location/of/backup if [ $? ! = "0" ] ; then echo "rsync backup failed." else tar -acf /var/backup/home- ` date +%Y%m%d ` .tar.zst /location/of/backup fi
